column4: Hi folks, why this command "date -s 100909402009" returns me invalid date ??
you don't have a hardware clock interface available
is it still possible to define the system time?
should be, try using ntp to set it eg: sudo ntpdate ntp.ubuntu.com
also make sure your locale is set correctly
gnr what happens if you do a ls -la /dev/rtc
gnr what happens if you do a ls -la /dev/rtc0
does your BIOS support a rtc?
